Alice is offering me $400,000 and keeping $600,000 for herself. If I reject, we'll go to another round where I can make a proposal, but the total amount will be worth less due to inflation (10% less valuable to me, 20% less valuable to Alice).

This means if we go to the next round, the $1,000,000 will effectively be worth $900,000 to me and $800,000 to Alice. This gives me some negotiating power in the next round because Alice has a higher inflation rate.

Given that I could potentially get a better deal in the next round, and Alice would be more motivated to accept due to her higher inflation rate, I'll reject this offer.
